metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3158 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The xrstor function in arch/x86/xstate.c in Xen 4.x does not properlyhandle writes to the hardware FSW.ES bit when running on AMD64 processors,which allows local guest OS users to obtain sensitive register contentinformation from another guest by leveraging pending exception and maskbits.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incorrect fix forCVE-2013-2076.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3158` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
